IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE AN INTER-INSTITUTIONAL FORUM TO IMPROVE COLLABORATION AMONG ITS MEMBER HOSPITALS IN THE GREATER HARTFORD CAPITAL REGION TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE HEALTH CARE NEEDS OF THE AREA. IN ADDITION, TO PROVIDE SUPPORT SERVICES IN THE FORM OF SALARY AND EMPLOYEE BENEFITS FOR TRAINING PROGRAMS SPONSORED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE AN INTER-INSTITUTIONAL FORUM TO IMPROVE COLLABORATION AMONG ITS MEMBER HOSPITALS IN THE GREATER HARTFORD CAPITAL REGION TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE HEALTH CARE NEEDS OF THE AREA. IN ADDITION, TO PROVIDE SUPPORT SERVICES IN THE FORM OF SALARY AND EMPLOYEE BENEFITS FOR TRAINING PROGRAMS SPONSORED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT.
IRS990.Desc: MEDICAL RESIDENCY PAYMASTER PROGRAM - THE CONSORTIUM WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MANAGEMENT AND COORDINATION OF PAYROLL AND BENEFIT SERVICES FOR MEDICAL RESIDENTS WHO WERE APPOINTED VIA THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT SCHOOL OF MEDICINE RESIDENCY TRAINING PROGRAM TO AREA HOSPITALS. THE CONSORTIUM ALSO PAYS FOR CERTAIN OPERATING EXPENSES ON BEHALF OF THE PROGRAM. DURING THE YEAR, THE CONSORTIUM MANAGED THE PAYROLL AND BENEFIT SERVICES OF APPROXIMATELY 700 MEDICAL RESIDENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: DENTAL RESIDENCY PAYMASTER PROGRAM - THE CONSORTIUM WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MANAGEMENT AND COORDINATION OF PAYROLL AND BENEFIT SERVICES FOR DENTAL RESIDENTS WHO WERE APPOINTED VIA THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT SCHOOL OF DENTAL MEDICINE. THE CONSORTIUM ALSO PAYS FOR CERTAIN OPERATING EXPENSES ON BEHALF OF THE PROGRAM. DURING THE YEAR, THE CONSORTIUM MANAGED THE PAYROLL AND BENEFIT SERVICES OF APPROXIMATELY 60 DENTAL RESIDENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: MANAGEMENT FEES EARNED RELATED TO THE MEDICAL RESIDENCY AND PAYMASTER AND DENTAL RESIDENCY PAYMASTER PROGRAMS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONSORTIUM, A CONNECTICUT NONPROFIT CORPORATION, IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE CODE) AND HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE (IRS) AS AN ORGANIZATION GENERALLY EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES ON RELATED INCOME PURSUANT TO SECTION 501(A) OF THE CODE. THE CONSORTIUM HAS NO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS AT JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022. THE CONSORTIUM'S FEDERAL INFORMATION RETURNS PRIOR TO FISCAL YEAR 2020 ARE CLOSED AND MANAGEMENT CONTINUALLY EVALUATES EXPIRING STATUTES OF LIMITATIONS, AUDITS, PROPOSED SETTLEMENTS, CHANGES IN TAX LAW AND NEW AUTHORITATIVE RULINGS. IF THE CONSORTIUM WAS TO INCUR UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAXES, IT WOULD RECOGNIZE INTEREST AND PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH ANY TAX MATTERS AS PART OF THE INCOME TAX PROVISION AND INCLUDE ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES WITH THE RELATED TAX LIABILITY IN THE STATEMENTS OF FINANCIAL POSITION.

TO PROVIDE AN INTER-INSTITUTIONAL FORUM TO IMPROVE COLLABORATION AMONG ITS MEMBER HOSPITALS IN THE GREATER HARTFORD CAPITAL REGION TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE HEALTH CARE NEEDS OF THE AREA. IN ADDITION, TO PROVIDE SUPPORT SERVICES IN THE FORM OF SALARY AND EMPLOYEE BENEFITS FOR TRAINING PROGRAMS SPONSORED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF CONNECTICUT.
THE INSTITUTIONS REPRESENTED ARE THE MEMBERS.

THE INSTITUTIONS REPRESENTED ARE THE MEMBERS. UPON ADMISSION TO MEMBERSHIP IN THE CONSORTIUM, EACH MEMBER SHALL BE ENTITLED TO THE BENEFITS OF ALL PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY THE CONSORTIUM, TO VOTE UPON BUDGETS AND RELEVANT OPERATIONAL MATTERS, TO VOTE UPON APPLICATIONS FOR MEMBERSHIP OR TERMINATIONS OF MEMBERSHIP IN THE CONSORTIUM AND TO DESIGNATE THE NUMBER OF TRUSTEES IN ACCORDANCE WITH ARTICLE II, SECTION 1 OF THESE BYLAWS. THERE SHALL BE TWO (2) TRUSTEES FROM EACH MEMBER OF THE CONSORTIUM.
A COPY OF THE 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND THE TREASURER OF THE BOARD. A COPY OF THE FILED RETURN IS AVAILABLE TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS.

A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE AND ACKNOWLEDGEMENT FORM IS DISTRIBUTED TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS EVERY TWO YEARS. THE RESPONSES ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD CHAIR AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND IF A CONFLICT IS DISCLOSED, THE CHAIR WILL BRING TO THE ATTENTION OF THE BOARD AT THE NEXT MEETING. THE BOARD WILL DISCUSS AND VOTE ON THE CONFLICT WITHOUT THE TRUSTEE PRESENT AND IF NECESSARY REMOVE THE TRUSTEE FROM BOARD SERVICE.

COMPENSATION INCREASES ARE DETERMINED IN CONJUNCTION WITH BUDGET APPROVAL ON AN ANNUAL BASIS AND VOTED ON BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. SUCH VOTE IS DOCUMENTED IN THE MINUTES OF THE MEETING. UNLESS SPECIFICALLY SUPPORTED BY A LETTER FROM THE CHAIRMAN, THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR INCREASE CANNOT BE GREATER THAN THE PERCENTAGE APPROVED BY THE BOARD FOR THE ORGANIZATION.
THE CONSORTIUM'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: ST FRANCIS HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CE
